results.title: Life and health: the heart attack
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films and Norman Siegel
results.brief_description: The film opens with an extremely effective presentation of what it is like to have a heart attack. The structure and function of the heart are then discussed. Three most common forms of heart attack and their causes are examined in detail through an imaginative use of cinematic techniques. The relationship of cholesterol to heart attack is given major emphasis.

results.title: Life and health: the heart - counter attack
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films and Norman Siegel
results.brief_description: The major causes of heart disease weaken the heart to make a person vulnerable. Steps can be taken by the individual and society to decrease or eliminate these causes. Smoking, overweight and a lack of physical fitness are highlighted as prime causes of heart disease. Tension and stress and methods of overcoming their effect on the heart re dealt with.

results.title: Life along the waterways
results.creator_credit: Roy Wilcox, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John A. Haeseler
results.brief_description: Depicts the many forms of plant and animal life found near the streams, of ponds, rivers and marshes that make up a waterway system. Illustrates the dependence of the members of this community on the waterway, and points out their activities throughout the spring, summer and autumn seasons. The film indicates the physical changes of the waterway in its growth from a brook to a river.

results.title: Life after death
results.brief_description: Brings into focus the question of the persistence of consciousness after biological death. Dr. Lawrence LeShan presents the scientific view. At a session at the Monroe Institute with Robert Monroe, author of “Journeys Out of the Body”, participants learn that they are more than their physical body. Dr. Kenneth Ring interviews four who were clinically dead. Margaret Flavell, a British medium, communicates with the late A. D. Mattson, who describes the hereafter.

group_siblings.title: Everything was perfect and then I went insane

results.title: Life's burning desire
results.creator_credit: Martin Guinness, Stephen Cummins, Feel Good Films and Fleur Productions
results.brief_description: ‘Life burnings desire’ follows the path of dancer, choreographer and actor Paul Mercurio. Specifically, the programme focuses on Mercurio’s work with CONTACT, a new dance theatre piece conceived, choreographed and performed by Mercurio and his dance company ACE (Australian Choreographic Ensemble). His relationship with this project serves as a metaphor for his wider body of work.

results.title: Lies spies and Olympics
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Film Australia and Peter Butt
results.brief_description: The 1956 Olympic Games held in Melbourne have become etched in Australian mythology as a watershed in our sporting, cultural and civic history. This fascinating documentary examines the era in which they were held, post World War II, and how that influenced both the staging of the Games and some of the extraordinary events which occurred during it (such as the defection of Hungarian athletes). It looks beyond the myth to discover a compelling story of deceit, clashing egos and local and international politics which almost turned the so-called ‘Friendly Games’ into a national disaster.
